content.description: From your choice of edges at the left side of the face, pull on and stick the large gaston block, finagle some feet that allow you to match, then fire to a jug out right and top out on good holds. It looks so easy...
content.protection: Great landing, easily done solo with or without a pad.
content.location: On the west side of the boulder, climbing through the very obvious flat block. Easy downclimb.

content.description:
The lovely concave orange face just off the trail. Start at a sharp sidepull and a gaston on the left edge of the scoop, move to a right hand sidepull then head for the lip with a long reach. Use them feet! 

  The left arete is off, but is a fun ~V2 on its own.
content.protection: A crashpad and spotter are nice.
content.location: On the scooped orange face of the boulder, climbing right through its center. Easy walk-off.

content.description: This boulder is home to Gault's Pet Tree, a technical Gloria's classic climbing funky crimps through a scooped face. Also here on the opposite side of the boulder is Rotator Cuff, a powerful, tricky gaston problem. Aside from these two, one will find many worthwhile moderate problems.
